programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: No one becomes a bondsman overnight and even the members of Dog's team know there is always more to learn. So when Duane Lee cuts a felon a little too much slack about checking-in and then goes missing, Duane Lee knows he's gonna get schooled.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to liven things up with a competition. He and Beth will hunt for one fugitive, while Leland and Justin chase another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in for a big surprise after he catches a fugitive named Jonaven in a sting operation. In a teary heart-to-heart talk, Dog finds out that Jonaven's father was killed in a shoot-out with police when Jonaven was only 9. Dog then

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag" -- in this case a $20,000 bond. Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Colorado helping a fellow bondsmen clean up his files. The target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What better way for Dog to start his morning, than at an elementary school Career Day, inspiring a new generation of potential bounty hunters? After giving a rousing speech to an audience of enthusiastic grade-schoolers, Dog catches up with an old friend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team search for Jonah, a violent and desperate criminal facing 20 years in jail. The trail goes stale when Dog runs into evasive family members and an angry girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is hunting a man known as "The Godfather of Waikiki". The bond is small, Dog and Beth bailed him out as a courtesy, but now he is refusing to go to court. If Dog doesn't bring him in, it could cost him more than money.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A big heart can be a problem for a bail bondsman and today's hunt is a case in point. Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With twelve kids of his own Dog knows how hard it is to keep children on the straight and narrow, especially during their turbulent teens.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has history of domestic abuse and assault, and now he's facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks, but what if it's The Dog doing the teaching? Today's target is wanted on domestic abuse charges, but when Dog discovers she works for an escort service he opts for a new twist on an old ruse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: At The Glass House in Ambleside, Ramsay finds the restaurant owner close to tears as yet another Saturday night goes tits up. The head chef has a lot to explain as Ramsay decides he's the weak link.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Ramsay's got his work cut out to restore the reputation of The Walnut Tree Inn in Wales. When he arrives he finds the owner chef-less and broke and desperate to get the place back on it's feet.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Moore Place in Esher looks more like a rest home than a restaurant so it's no wonder the dining room's empty. Owners Nick and Richard are relying on Ramsay to fill it with customers on Mother's Day.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre dé Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~£150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to Connecticut’s oldest inn, the Curtis House. This historic inn has been run by the Hardisty family for generations, but the business has started to fall apart and the family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call “daddy”), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a “Caribbean” style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida where the young inexperienced owner, Brian is making guests’ time at the hotel miserable with filthy rooms, late night concerts and shocking service.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Island Park, Idaho to try and rescue the failing Angler’s Lodge. Despite building the stunning lodge with his own hands, owner Dave Ebey has lost his passion and it has almost cost him his business.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: He arrives at Brixton Prison in south London packed with drug dealers, burglars, muggers and thieves - some very unsavoury characters.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: Gordon has chosen his Bad Boys Brigade to work for his prison business, and now he has to trust the prisoners with sharp knives if they're to be able to cook on the inside and sell on the outside.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: Gordon's been at Brixton Prison for two months and it's time his Bad Boy Bakery business started bringing in some proper money.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: Gordon's served almost six months in Brixton Prison, but it will mean nothing if he doesn't leave a viable business behind to keep prisoners working and earning.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Shark Bait
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay sets out to investigate the controversial "shark fin soup."

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay starts his culinary journey in the north of India where he cooks for 400 passengers in an express train's cramped pantry car.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon immerses himself in the life of a local tribe in Nagaland, visits Assam to enter a housewives' competition and sets up shop on the streets of Calcutta.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon ends his travels to India by heading south, living in an ashram in Kerala and working alongside one of India's top chefs in Mumbai.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Harper’s Ferry in West Virginia, to try to save a historic hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Karan Townsend, the owner, runs the hotel like a thrift store and hoards junk everywhere.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon continues his mission to fix the failing Town’s Inn in Harper’s Ferry, West Virginia despite having to shut down the hotel after witnessing some shocking food practices. These are some of the worst Ramsay has encountered.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: The Vienna owner’s Jonathan and Lisa Krach are at their breaking point and have become trapped in their Austrian themed hotel, drowning in debt. Gordon discovers some shocking rumors about the owners and the real reason customers have stopped coming.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Newtown in Pennsylvania, to try and save a historic hotel that is desperately in need of help. Verindar, the owner, runs the hotel like an angry tyrant. Her staff is ready to quit because they are so unhappy with the way they are treated.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~£1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The Dovecote is a bistro in the heart of rural Devon run by a family at breaking point. The restaurant is on its last legs - they've run out of customers, money and hope. Enter Gordon, who on his first visit to the bistro is confronted with hideous wallpaper, vacuum packed lamb and a pig-headed head chef and owner who can't face up to his mistakes. Gordon has a torrid time putting them on the road to recovery, but come the autumn, they are sticking to his rules and business is looking brighter.
With the advent of the credit crunch, soaring food prices, thrifty clientele and unrelenting competition from the high street chains, Gordon is determined to galvanise the owners, the staff and the local community to ensure their survival and keep customers coming back for more.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When a young Arizona businessman is found slaughtered in his bathroom, friends point police towards his ex-girlfriend; facing the death penalty, Jodi Arias takes the stand for 18 days in an attempt to explain how the killing was self-defense.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When an off-duty Dallas police officer shoots a man in his own apartment, the jury decides if it was murder or a tragic mistake; Amber Guyger takes the stand in her own defense to convince the jury not to lock her away for up to 99 years.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When a parolee is bounced from his job, he seeks retribution on a peaceful community when he kidnaps, tortures and kills a mother and caregiver; Scott Nelson takes the stand to give a convoluted explanation on why he blames his parole officer.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: Shayna Hubers takes the stand to defend herself after brutally murdering her on-again, off-again boyfriend, Ryan Poston; she willingly takes the stand to prove her actions were in self-defense, by showing Ryan's abusive side.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Racial tensions in Buffalo in 1980 were at an all-time high. Six black males had been brutally murdered--two had their hearts cut out. The only thing connecting the victims was their ethnicity and the fact that each had been shot with .22 caliber bullets. Residents screamed for the police to stop this serial killer. With no suspects, local investigators turned to the FBI. Profilers were able to produce a psychological composite of the type of person the killer would most likely be. Their analysis paid off.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Racial tensions in Buffalo in 1980 were at an all-time high. Six black males had been brutally murdered--two had their hearts cut out. The only thing connecting the victims was their ethnicity and the fact that each had been shot with .22 caliber bullets. Residents screamed for the police to stop this serial killer. With no suspects, local investigators turned to the FBI. Profilers were able to produce a psychological composite of the type of person the killer would most likely be. Their analysis paid off.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a chilly afternoon in 1989, Marine Captain Shirley Russell disappeared from Quantico, Virginia. Captain Russell was a dedicated officer; her friends and colleagues were certain she had not gone AWOL. FBI agents found her husband, a former Marine, was acting strangely, and a blood-like stain on the couple's floor disappeared before agents could examine it. There was no body, no witness and no weapon.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. programme.desc: Online deepfakes and disinformation are targeting women, including prom photos turned into porn. Special explores the devastating impact on women in the age of online harassment.

programme.title: The Moses Diaries
programme.desc: 'Moses' captures the reality of war through his own camera, offering a raw, unfiltered perspective on the sacrifices of a Ukrainian generation fighting for freedom and a window into the grim realities of the frontline that Ukraine commanders do not want the world to see.

programme.title: Descent Into Anarchy
programme.desc: The human toll as Haiti's paramilitary gangs use automatic weapons, child soldiers and sexual violence to terrorize.

programme.title: Bionic Warriors
programme.desc: Cutting-edge technology is transforming wounded soldiers' lives. Bionic limbs are restoring hope, mobility, and purpose for amputee heroes.

programme.title: Next Level: Do Video Games Help Or Hurt Our Mental Health?
programme.desc: In this episode, Next Level looks at the mental health conversation around video games. Are they addictive? Do they encourage aggression? Or are they just the target of moral panic?

programme.title: Next Level: Are We On The Brink Of Gaming's Cinematic Golden Age?
programme.desc: Video games and movies have a lot of things in common; but a lot of the efforts to adapt one franchise into another have historically met with failure. This episode of Next Level looks at the intersection between games and film: what elements get in the way of a good adaptation, and how creatives from both industries are working to bridge the gap.

programme.title: Next Level: Can Modders Save Games By Breaking Them?
programme.desc: There's a long-standing tradition of amateur game developers tinkering with the content of finished games. These so-called "modders" have shaped the industry trends and given players more control over their games - but their work can risk backlash from the increasingly corporate video game industry.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures

programme.title: Chibok Kidnapping
programme.desc: On April 14, 2014, 276 mostly Christian female teenage students were kidnapped by the Islamic terrorist group Boko Haram from the Government Girls Secondary School at the town of Chibok in Borno State, Nigeria. This episode features a survivor who escaped the kidnappers and is now a social worker living in Charleston, South Carolina. Dozens of girls are still missing today. The event got international media coverage and attention from a massive social media campaign.

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Operation Komex: Selling Sarin
programme.desc: US Customs agent Rick Kennan masquerades as a weapons dealer to get inside a Korean arms operation that's soliciting military secrets and weapons. The case explodes when Kennan learns the arms dealer is looking to purchase sarin gas for a Middle East nation. The dealer will do anything for a price. But can Kennan move fast enough to intercept the 500 quarter-ton sarin bombs before they are delivered into the wrong hands?

programme.desc: A months-long investigation into members of the national guard being denied medical care for injuries sustained in the line of duty; a look at the surprisingly high number of bridge strikes happening in the US and why so many bridges weren't built to sustain a direct hit; And we explore the booming online market for counterfeit diet drugs.

programme.title: Sex, Lies and Deepfakes
programme.desc: Online deepfakes and disinformation are targeting women, including prom photos turned into porn. Special explores the devastating impact on women in the age of online harassment.

programme.title: The Moses Diaries
programme.desc: 'Moses' captures the reality of war through his own camera, offering a raw, unfiltered perspective on the sacrifices of a Ukrainian generation fighting for freedom and a window into the grim realities of the frontline that Ukraine commanders do not want the world to see.

programme.title: Descent Into Anarchy
programme.desc: The human toll as Haiti's paramilitary gangs use automatic weapons, child soldiers and sexual violence to terrorize.

programme.title: Next Level: Do Video Games Help Or Hurt Our Mental Health?
programme.desc: In this episode, Next Level looks at the mental health conversation around video games. Are they addictive? Do they encourage aggression? Or are they just the target of moral panic?

programme.title: Next Level: Are We On The Brink Of Gaming's Cinematic Golden Age?
programme.desc: Video games and movies have a lot of things in common; but a lot of the efforts to adapt one franchise into another have historically met with failure. This episode of Next Level looks at the intersection between games and film: what elements get in the way of a good adaptation, and how creatives from both industries are working to bridge the gap.

programme.title: Next Level: Can Modders Save Games By Breaking Them?
programme.desc: There's a long-standing tradition of amateur game developers tinkering with the content of finished games. These so-called "modders" have shaped the industry trends and given players more control over their games - but their work can risk backlash from the increasingly corporate video game industry.

programme.title: Next Level: Can Video Games Really Be For Everyone?
programme.desc: Next Level: Can Video Games Really Be For Everyone?

programme.title: Fabulous Felines
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science of the cat. We'll learn about the evolution of cats throughout the world, featuring the Saber-tooth Tiger. Find out how cat senses stack up against other animals. And take a pop quiz that reveals some incredible feline facts.

programme.title: Australian Animals
programme.desc: In this episode we travel to the land down under - Australia. Learn the science behind the one of the world's largest natural wonders, the Great Barrier Reef. See the ferocity of the Tasmanian devil, and meet the cute and cuddly Koala Bear.

programme.title: Canadian Rockies
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the natural beauty of the Canadian Rockies. Philippe canoes on the famous, glacier-fed Lake Louise at Banff National Park. We hike up a glacier at Jasper National Park. We discover what's being done to preserve the Woodland Caribou and White Bark Pine Trees. And we visit an archaeologist who provides artifacts our ancestors used while living in the Canadian Rockies 10,000 years ago.

programme.title: Earth's Views
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and learns how a fleet of satellites is monitoring our planet. Philippe flies in a DC3 aircraft over Arizona as part of NASA's efforts to take soil moisture readings. We visit an observatory in the Province of Quebec, where new stars are being discovered. And we take a spacewalk with astronauts and see planet earth from a whole, new perspective.

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Next Level: What Does The Future Of Video Games Look Like?
programme.desc: Video games have been on the cutting edge of technology for decades; today, they're ground zero for some of the trends that could shape our technological future. This episode of Next Level examines what the future of the video game industry might look like - for better or for worse.

programme.title: Next Level: Hollywood Strikes Against AI
programme.desc: Artificial intelligence is poised to completely change the film and TV industries, but Hollywood's workers want a say in how it develops.

programme.title: Japan
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Japan

programme.title: Chibok Kidnapping
programme.desc: On April 14, 2014, 276 mostly Christian female teenage students were kidnapped by the Islamic terrorist group Boko Haram from the Government Girls Secondary School at the town of Chibok in Borno State, Nigeria. This episode features a survivor who escaped the kidnappers and is now a social worker living in Charleston, South Carolina. Dozens of girls are still missing today. The event got international media coverage and attention from a massive social media campaign.

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.desc: See No Evil

programme.title: Love Blind
programme.desc: In Buford, GA a wife begins a cyber affair which has deadly consequences, while in Raleigh, NC a medical aids researcher suffers unusual medical problems his doctors can't explain.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: The Last Dance

programme.title: Turmoil
programme.desc: Turmoil

programme.title: Operation Thin Crust: Destroying The Vegas Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Charlie Maurer partners with a mob hitman to penetrate the Vegas Mafia and take them down. Maurer uses the hitman as a Trojan horse and they form a tenuous alliance to gather evidence against the hitman's former partners in crime. Maurer drives a stake into the heart of the old school mobsters, and ends any chance of them regaining their former glory on the strip.

programme.title: Operation Orozco: Cartel Laundry
programme.desc: FBI agent Ed Guillen goes undercover as a banker to cozy up with a Columbian cartel member and help launder his dirty cash. Guillen launders millions while taping incriminating conversations that will eventually convict the drug kingpin. In the end, Guillen uses his cunning to befriend the kingpin and get him to confess the extent of his illegal operation. The agent gains his trust and the dealer is sent to prison, forfeiting millions.

programme.title: Operation Lockdown: Imprisoned Cop Killer
programme.desc: FBI agent Steve Salmieri takes on the alias of a mob hitman to go inside a prison to get evidence against a cop killer incarcerated on another charge. Salmieri rebuffs the cop killer's attempts at friendship, to convince him he's not someone to mess with. While wired for sound, Salmieri gets dozens of conversations on tape against the perp, but will it be enough to convict him of the murder of a police officer?

programme.title: Operation Komex: Selling Sarin
programme.desc: US Customs agent Rick Kennan masquerades as a weapons dealer to get inside a Korean arms operation that's soliciting military secrets and weapons. The case explodes when Kennan learns the arms dealer is looking to purchase sarin gas for a Middle East nation. The dealer will do anything for a price. But can Kennan move fast enough to intercept the 500 quarter-ton sarin bombs before they are delivered into the wrong hands?

programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: Casanova Serial Killer
programme.desc: A good-looking wanderer picks up women and after charming them, he kills them. Also, as a military doctor explains how intruders terrorized and killed his wife and children, something doesn't add up.

programme.title: A Motown Family Tragedy
programme.desc: Motown legend Marvin Gaye is shot and killed in a family tragedy that involves abuse, heated arguments and drugs. Also, when a prominent doctor's wife slips and falls in the shower, investigators see that it's not a fatal accident.

programme.title: Five Marriages And Five Dead Husbands
programme.desc: Something doesn't add up when years of broken marriages result in the deaths of five husbands. Also, a man obsessed with his faith goes on a deadly rampage.

programme.title: Sex, Lies and Deepfakes
programme.desc: Online deepfakes and disinformation are targeting women, including prom photos turned into porn. Special explores the devastating impact on women in the age of online harassment.

programme.title: The Moses Diaries
programme.desc: 'Moses' captures the reality of war through his own camera, offering a raw, unfiltered perspective on the sacrifices of a Ukrainian generation fighting for freedom and a window into the grim realities of the frontline that Ukraine commanders do not want the world to see.

programme.title: Canadian Rockies
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the natural beauty of the Canadian Rockies. Philippe canoes on the famous, glacier-fed Lake Louise at Banff National Park. We hike up a glacier at Jasper National Park. We discover what's being done to preserve the Woodland Caribou and White Bark Pine Trees. And we visit an archaeologist who provides artifacts our ancestors used while living in the Canadian Rockies 10,000 years ago.

programme.title: Earth's Views
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and learns how a fleet of satellites is monitoring our planet. Philippe flies in a DC3 aircraft over Arizona as part of NASA's efforts to take soil moisture readings. We visit an observatory in the Province of Quebec, where new stars are being discovered. And we take a spacewalk with astronauts and see planet earth from a whole, new perspective.

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Next Level: What Does The Future Of Video Games Look Like?
programme.desc: Video games have been on the cutting edge of technology for decades; today, they're ground zero for some of the trends that could shape our technological future. This episode of Next Level examines what the future of the video game industry might look like - for better or for worse.

programme.title: Chibok Kidnapping
programme.desc: On April 14, 2014, 276 mostly Christian female teenage students were kidnapped by the Islamic terrorist group Boko Haram from the Government Girls Secondary School at the town of Chibok in Borno State, Nigeria. This episode features a survivor who escaped the kidnappers and is now a social worker living in Charleston, South Carolina. Dozens of girls are still missing today. The event got international media coverage and attention from a massive social media campaign.

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Next Level: Do Video Games Help Or Hurt Our Mental Health?
programme.desc: In this episode, Next Level looks at the mental health conversation around video games. Are they addictive? Do they encourage aggression? Or are they just the target of moral panic?

programme.title: Next Level: Are We On The Brink Of Gaming's Cinematic Golden Age?
programme.desc: Video games and movies have a lot of things in common; but a lot of the efforts to adapt one franchise into another have historically met with failure. This episode of Next Level looks at the intersection between games and film: what elements get in the way of a good adaptation, and how creatives from both industries are working to bridge the gap.

programme.title: Operation Orozco: Cartel Laundry
programme.desc: FBI agent Ed Guillen goes undercover as a banker to cozy up with a Columbian cartel member and help launder his dirty cash. Guillen launders millions while taping incriminating conversations that will eventually convict the drug kingpin. In the end, Guillen uses his cunning to befriend the kingpin and get him to confess the extent of his illegal operation. The agent gains his trust and the dealer is sent to prison, forfeiting millions.

programme.title: Operation Lockdown: Imprisoned Cop Killer
programme.desc: FBI agent Steve Salmieri takes on the alias of a mob hitman to go inside a prison to get evidence against a cop killer incarcerated on another charge. Salmieri rebuffs the cop killer's attempts at friendship, to convince him he's not someone to mess with. While wired for sound, Salmieri gets dozens of conversations on tape against the perp, but will it be enough to convict him of the murder of a police officer?

programme.title: Operation Komex: Selling Sarin
programme.desc: US Customs agent Rick Kennan masquerades as a weapons dealer to get inside a Korean arms operation that's soliciting military secrets and weapons. The case explodes when Kennan learns the arms dealer is looking to purchase sarin gas for a Middle East nation. The dealer will do anything for a price. But can Kennan move fast enough to intercept the 500 quarter-ton sarin bombs before they are delivered into the wrong hands?
